intro: Desmostachys planchonianus f. subrotundatus, commonly known as the broad-leaved desmostachys, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its broad, rounded leaves and yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands or along stream banks. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like South Africa and Namibia. The subspecies subrotundatus is distinguished by its more rounded leaf shape compared to the typical form.
